Title: Object: Papyrus Ramesseum 4
Description: P. Ramesseum 4, Frame 6. Papyrus written on the recto in hieratic script. The recto contains a magico-medical text related to pregnancy and birth/mother and child. On the verso there are some later accounts. The text is written in vertical columns. This frame contains lines Di 1-2, Dii 1-4 and Diii 2-5. The papyrus was a full-height roll. The papyrus is part of the collection of papyri found with a bundle of pens in a chest from a plundered late 13th dynasty tomb under the Ramesseum, apparently belonging to someone like a lector priest. Two of the papyri from the chest are in the Egyptian Museum Berlin (P. Ramesseum A and D); the objects are in the Fitzwilliam Museum Cambridge and the Manchester Museum. The papyri are very fragile, apparently due to dampness in the tomb-shaft. This papyrus was mounted on sheets of gelatin by Hugo Ibscher.
Curator's comments: P. Ramesseum 4 lines Di 1-2, Dii 1-4, Diii 1-5. A. H. Gardiner, The Ramesseum Papyri (Oxford: Oxford University Press 1955), 9. J. W. B. Barns, Five Ramesseum Papyri (Oxford: Oxford University Press 1956), 24-9, pl.19, pl. 25 (verso). This papyrus is being studied by Pierre Meyrat (Geneva). W. Westendorf, Handbuch der altägyptischen Medizin (Handbuch der Orientalistik Abt. 1, 36; Leiden, Boston and Köln: Brill 1999), 11-15. On the conservation of the papyri: B. Leach, 'A conservation history of the Ramesseum Papyri', JEA 92 (2006), 225-40. On the tomb: R. B. Parkinson, Reading Ancient Egyptian Poetry: Among Other Histories (Chichester and Malden: Wiley-Blackwell 2009), 138-72.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380844) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380844)
